t: For the director of music. With stringed instruments. According to sheminith. A psalm of David.
Lord,*spn do not rebuke me in your anger or*ld discipline me in your wrath.
Have*ln mercy on me, Lord,*s for I am faint; heal*ld me, Lord,*s for my bones are in agony.
My*ln soul is in deep anguish. How*ld long, Lord,*s how long?
Turn,*pn Lord,*s and deliver me; save*ld me because of your unfailing love.
Among*ln the dead no one proclaims your name. Who*ld praises you from the grave?
I*pn am worn out from my groaning. All*pn night long I flood my bed with weeping and*ld drench my couch with tears.
My*ln eyes grow weak with sorrow; they*ld fail because of all my foes.
Away*pn from me, all you who do evil, for*ld the Lord*s has heard my weeping.
The*ln Lord*s has heard my cry for mercy; the*ld Lord*s accepts my prayer.
All*ln my enemies will be overwhelmed with shame and anguish; they*ld will turn back and suddenly be put to shame.
